alert.note: Alert for Lake (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 5:41PM EDT until September 17 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Lake, Orange, Seminole and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Deltona, Sanford, DeLand, Lake Mary, Orange City, Lake Helen, DeBary, Cassia, Mount Plymouth, Osteen, Lake Monroe, Valdez, Enterprise, Central Florida Zoo, High Banks, Blue Spring State Park, Sanford Airport, Heathrow, Cassadaga and Hontoon Island State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
